isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CAB - TILT: 9800 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - WINDSHIELD GLASS

svcprocinfo.para: Refer to Figure 13 for Items in parentheses.

The windshield is a two-piece curved glass type (Item 2). A molded one-piece, two section weatherseal (Item 3) with an integral or detached weatherseal locking strip (zipper strip) fits around the perimeter of the weatherseal to retain the windshield glass on the body flange (weld flange) of the windshield opening. The separation between the windshield halves is accomplished by a center (vertical) weatherseal with an integral or detached weatherseal locking strip (zipper strip) (Item 1) which fits in the middle of the weatherseal to retain the windshield glass, and is part of the molded one-piece, two section weatherseal. The center (vertical) weatherseal section is held in place by the center divider bar (Item 4) which is attached to the body cowl and roof with rivets. When replacing the windshield, examine the weatherseal for cuts, distortion or signs of leaking. If any of these signs are present, replace the weatherseal.

svcsubproc.title: Remove
svcsubproc.para: If either the windshield glass or the weatherseal needs to be replaced, the following procedures should be used.

warning.para: Use a secure work platform, high enough to enable a person outside the front of the vehicle to comfortably and safely perform the windshield glass and weatherseal removal and installation.

step1.para: Remove the windshield washer hose ( Item 1, Figure 14) from the fitting ( Item 2, Figure 14).

Lift the spring loaded lock latch ( Item 3, Figure 14) to unlock the wiper arm ( Item 4, Figure 14) and lift the wiper arm off the serrated drive bushing on the pivot arm shaft. Note the position of the wiper blade on the windshield.

figure.caption: Figure 14. Wiper Arm and Washer Hose

step1.para: Carefully pry one end of the weatherseal locking strip ( Item 2, Figure 15), located below the center (vertical) portion of the weatherseal, with a seal tool ( Item 1, Figure 15) and peel it from the perimeter of the weatherseal.

Carefully pry the center weatherseal locking strip ( Item 1, Figure 16) from the center (vertical) portion of the weatherseal ( Item 2, Figure 16) with a seal tool ( Item 1, Figure 15) and peel it from the weatherseal.

If the right and left side windshield sections ( Item 3, Figure 16) are not damaged and it is necessary to replace the weatherseal ( Item 3, Figure 13) only, it is advisable to first cut away the portion of the weatherseal which is molded around the window body flange of the cab. Cutting away the weatherseal ( Item 3, Figure 13) will allow easier removal of the windshield sections ( Item 3, Figure 16) and lessen the possibility of breaking the glass being removed.

If the weatherseal ( Item 3, Figure 13) is not damaged and you are replacing the right or left side windshield section ( Item 3, Figure 16) only, use a seal tool ( Item 1, Figure 17) between the weatherseal ( Item 2, Figure 17) and the windshield Item 3, Figure 17). From the outside, run the seal tool around the perimeter of the windshield section being removed.

figure.caption: Figure 17. Use Seal Tool Between Weatherseal and Windshield

step1.para: Working with one person outside the cab and an assistant inside, apply pressure at the top of the right or left side windshield section ( Item 1, Figure 18) from inside the cab to push the glass from the weatherseal ( Item 2, Figure 18). Be careful during this operation since heavy pressure at any one point can lead to glass breakage.

figure.caption: Figure 18. Push Windshield Glass From Weatherseal

step1.para: Lift the windshield section ( Item 1, Figure 18) from the weatherseal ( Item 2, Figure 18). If replacing the weatherseal ( Item 1, Figure 19), peel the weatherseal from the body flange (weld flange) ( Item 2, Figure 19) and the center (vertical) weatherseal section ( Item 3, Figure 19) from the center divider bar ( Item 4, Figure 19).

figure.caption: Figure 19. Peel Weatherseal From Body Flange

svcsubproc.title: Install
svcsubproc.para: As specified in the following installation procedures, a high grade butyl or urethane sealing material is required during certain steps.

caution.para: Do not use silicon-based products. Paint damage may occur.

step1.para: If the weatherseal ( Item 1, Figure 19) was removed, install as follows.

step2.para: Position the center (vertical) portion of the weatherseal ( Item 3, Figure 19) into center divider bar ( Item 4, Figure 19).
Install the weatherseal ( Item 1, Figure 20) to the perimeter of the body flange (weld flange) ( Item 2, Figure 20) of the windshield opening.

figure.caption: Figure 20. Install Weatherseal to Perimeter of Body Flange

step1.para: Apply a bead of sealer around the entire perimeter of the weatherseal ( Item 1, Figure 20) between the weatherseal and the body flange (weld flange) ( Item 2, Figure 20).

Apply a soapy solution or rubber lubricant to the glass channels in the weatherseal ( Item 1, Figure 21) as often as necessary. Position the right or left side windshield section ( Item 2, Figure 21) into the bottom glass channel ( Item 3, Figure 21) and slide the windshield section into the center (vertical) portion of the weatherseal ( Item 4, Figure 21) glass channel.

figure.caption: Figure 21. Position Windshield Section into Bottom Glass Channel

step1.para: Use seal tools, and work the right or left side windshield section ( Item 1, Figure 22) into the center (vertical) portion of the weatherseal ( Item 2, Figure 22) glass channel, then work the windshield section into the other side and top portion of the weatherseal ( Figure 23) glass channel.

figure.caption: Figure 22. Use Seal Tool to Work Windshield Section into Center Portion
Figure 23. Work Windshield Section into Side and Top Portions

step1.para: Apply a soapy solution or rubber lubricant to the weatherseal locking strip groove ( Item 2, Figure 24) as often as necessary, then starting below the center (vertical) portion of the weatherseal ( Item 1, Figure 25), use a locking strip installation tool, similar to Item 4 in Figure 25 and install the weatherseal locking strip ( Item 2, Figure 25) into the locking strip groove around the entire weatherseal ( Item 3, Figure 25).

figure.caption: Figure 24. Apply Soapy Solution to Locking Strip Groove

step1.para: Apply a soapy solution or rubber lubricant to the center (vertical) weatherseal locking strip groove ( Item 2, Figure 26), then install the center (vertical) weatherseal locking strip ( Item 1, Figure 27) into the center (vertical) portion of the weatherseal ( Item 2, Figure 27).

figure.caption: Figure 26. Apply Soapy Solution to Center Weatherseal Locking Strip Groove
Figure 27. Install Center Weatherseal Locking Strip

step1.para: Attach the wiper arm ( Item 1, Figure 28) on the serrated drive bushing on the pivot arm shaft so that the wiper blade ( Item 1, Figure 29) is 3/4 to 1 inch (19.05 to 25 mm) ( Item 2, Figure 29) above the weatherseal ( Item 3, Figure 29) with the wipers off and in the park position.

figure.caption: Figure 28. Attach Wiper Arm and Washer Hose

step1.para: Install the windshield washer hose ( Item 2, Figure 28) to the appropriate fittings ( Item 3, Figure 28).
Clean all excess sealer and rubber lubricants, if used, from the windshield area.
